issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: yarn rmadmin -getGroups returns group from which the user has been removed

comments.body: Changes to this issue is is YARN. converting as a YARN ticket.

Test steps:
{noformat}
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "groupadd testUser5" root
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "useradd testUser5 -g testUser5" root
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "groupadd Group5" root
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "usermod -a -G Group5 testUser5" root
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# groups testUser5
testUser5 : testUser5 Group5
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "yarn rmadmin -refreshUserToGroupsMappings" yarn
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "yarn rmadmin -getGroups testUser5" yarn
testUser5 : testUser5 Group5
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "gpasswd -d testUser5 Group5" root
Removing user testUser5 from group Group5
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# groups testUser5
testUser5 : testUser5
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "yarn rmadmin -refreshUserToGroupsMappings" yarn
[root@abc.com hadoop-yarn]# sudo su - -c "yarn rmadmin -getGroups testUser5" yarn
testUser5 : testUser5{noformat}
In Summary, *sudo su - -c "yarn rmadmin -getGroups testUser5" yarn* and *groups testUser5* gives same o/p.

 

[~leftnoteasy] pls help to review the patch. We also had to make change in AdminService.java in addition to RM init call.

Thanks [~sunilg] for working on the patch.

I'm not sure if this patch is correct: 

For Groups#getUserToGroupsMappingServiceWithLoadedConfiguration, it always creates a new GROUPS instance and replace the static variable. I think we should avoid invoking the method, instead of changing AdminService, I think we can change RM#init to use 

{\{Groups getUserToGroupsMappingService(Configuration conf)}}

Instead.

Thoughts?

Thanks [~leftnoteasy] .

Ideally calling refresh from RM#init is not need at all as *refreshAll* will be invoked when RM switches to active. So i think lets remove the call from RM#init and keep admin service as it is. Updating patch.
Tested same test case and its working fine.

Test cases are passing with this patch in a real cluster.
